answerText: Carl Friedrich Gauss[10] Gauss's golden theorem concerns the solvability of one of these statements between some square modulo some prime number. These statements are represented by a symbol that looks like an equals sign with an extra horizontal line in the middle.
heading: MUT |2014 | 3 | 19 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This scientist gave the first proof of the law of quadratic reciprocity, which is sometimes called his namesake "golden theorem." For 10 points each: [10] Name this scientist, who also names a function whose integral is referred to as the "error function."
